storyContent.tagHTML: In 607 B.C., three learned Brahmin brothers lived in the state of Magadh: Indrabhuti, Agnibhuti, and Väyubhuti. Indrabhuti was the most prominent, a master of the Vedas with 500 disciples. He was chosen as the head priest for a grand sacrificial ceremony (Yajna) organized by a Brahmin named Somil in the city of Apäpä.

As the Yajna was about to begin, celestial beings were seen descending from the heavens. Indrabhuti rejoiced, believing they were coming to bless his ceremony. To his shock and anger, the beings bypassed his event and went to the nearby Mahäsen forest to honor Bhagawän Mahävir, who had just attained Keval-jnän (omniscience). His pride wounded, Indrabhuti went with his disciples to challenge Mahävir in a debate.

Mahävir welcomed Indrabhuti by name and immediately addressed his innermost, secret doubt: the existence of the soul (Ätmä). Mahävir explained the true meaning of the scriptures, proving the soul's existence. Stunned by this omniscience, Indrabhuti's pride vanished. He realized the limits of his own knowledge and, at the age of 50, became Mahävir's first and chief disciple, known as Gautam-swämi. His ten fellow scholars and all their disciples followed suit, becoming the eleven Ganadhars.

Gautam-swämi was a devoted disciple, but his journey was not without lessons. In one instance, he doubted a layman, Änand Shrävak, who claimed to have attained a high level of clairvoyance (Avadhi-jnän). Mahävir confirmed Änand was truthful, and Gautam-swämi, without ego, immediately went back to ask for Änand's forgiveness.

On another occasion, Gautam-swämi used a special power, Akshin-mahänisi Labdhi, to miraculously feed 1500 hungry hermits from a single small bowl of kheer (rice pudding). Despite his powers and devotion, he could not attain Keval-jnän. Mahävir explained, “Gautam, you have too much affection for me. To attain omniscience, you must overcome all attachment, even to your Guru.”

On the day of his Nirväna, Mahävir purposefully sent Gautam-swämi away. Upon learning of Mahävir's departure, Gautam-swämi was consumed by grief. In that sorrow, he finally realized his deep attachment was the final barrier. Letting go of that attachment, he instantly destroyed his remaining Ghäti Karma and attained Keval-jnän. This happened on the first day of the New Year, the day after Mahävir's Nirväna on Diwäli.

events.title: A Learned Brahmin
events.description: Indrabhuti Gautam, along with his two brothers, is a renowned scholar of the Vedas, with 500 disciples of his own.

events.title: The Yajna of Somil
events.description: Indrabhuti is chosen as the head priest for a major sacrificial ceremony (Yajna) in the city of Apäpä.

events.title: Celestial Beings Descend
events.description: Indrabhuti sees celestial beings descending, but they bypass his ceremony to honor Bhagawän Mahävir.

events.title: A Challenge is Made
events.description: Feeling his pride wounded, Indrabhuti goes to the Mahäsen forest to challenge Mahävir in a scholarly debate.

events.title: The First Ganadhar
events.description: Mahävir addresses Indrabhuti's secret doubt about the soul. Humbled and enlightened, Indrabhuti becomes his first and chief disciple (Ganadhar).

events.title: Lesson in Humility
events.description: He mistakenly doubts the layman Änand Shrävak's spiritual powers and has to ask for his forgiveness.

events.title: Miracle of the Kheer
events.description: Using his special Labdhi power, he feeds 1500 hungry hermits from a single, small bowl of rice pudding.

events.title: The Barrier of Attachment
events.description: Mahävir explains that Gautam-swämi's deep affection for him is the only thing preventing him from attaining Keval-jnän.

events.title: The Final Test
events.description: Mahävir sends Gautam-swämi away on his last day. The subsequent grief forces Gautam-swämi to confront and overcome his attachment.

events.title: Keval-jnän Attained
events.description: By letting go of his attachment, Gautam-swämi instantly attains Keval-jnän, the day after Diwäli (on New Year's Day).

events.title: Final Liberation
events.description: At age ninety-two, Gautam-swämi attains Nirväna.

charactersData.name: Ganadhar Gautam-swämi
charactersData.description: Originally Indrabhuti, a proud and learned Brahmin scholar. He became Bhagawän Mahävir's first and chief disciple (Ganadhar) after his pride was humbled by Mahävir's omniscience. His story highlights the need to overcome even noble attachments.

charactersData.name: Bhagawän Mahävir
charactersData.description: The 24th Tirthankar, who, with his omniscience, guided Gautam-swämi by identifying his innermost doubts and the spiritual attachments that were holding him back.

charactersData.name: Änand Shrävak
charactersData.description: A devout layman (Shrävak) who, through severe austerities, attained a high level of clairvoyance (Avadhi-jnän), providing a lesson in humility for Gautam-swämi.

charactersData.name: Somil
charactersData.description: The Brahmin who organized the grand Yajna (sacrificial ceremony) that was unintentionally upstaged by Bhagawän Mahävir's first sermon.

charactersData.name: The 10 Other Scholars
charactersData.description: Indrabhuti's learned colleagues who, one by one, also challenged Mahävir and subsequently became his disciples, forming the 11 Ganadhars.

quizData.question: Who organized the sacrificial ceremony (Yajna) in Apäpä?
Why did the celestial beings ignore the Yajna and go to the Mahäsen forest instead?
quizData.answer: To pay homage to Bhagawän Mahävir, who had just attained Keval-jnän.

quizData.question: What was Indrabhuti's secret, innermost doubt that Mahävir revealed?
quizData.answer: He had doubts about the existence of the soul (Ätmä).

quizData.question: In which language did Mahävir deliver his first sermon?
How many Ganadhars (chief disciples) did Bhagawän Mahävir have in total?
What is the name of the layman who attained a high degree of clairvoyance?
What mistake did Gautam-swämi make regarding Änand Shrävak, for which he had to repent?
quizData.answer: He doubted the truthfulness of the high level of clairvoyance Änand claimed to have.

quizData.question: How many hermits did Gautam-swämi accept as disciples at the foothill of Mount Ashtäpad?
What is the name of the special power Gautam-swämi used to feed all the hermits from one small bowl?
What was the main obstacle that prevented Gautam-swämi from attaining Keval-jnän for so long?
quizData.answer: His deep affection and attachment to his guru, Bhagawän Mahävir.

quizData.question: Why did Mahävir send Gautam-swämi away on the day of his Nirväna?
quizData.answer: To help him overcome his attachment, which was necessary for him to attain Keval-jnän.

quizData.question: What realization finally allowed Gautam-swämi to attain Keval-jnän?
quizData.answer: The realization that no one can live forever and that his attachment to Mahävir was a worldly bond he had to break.

quizData.question: On which festival day did Bhagawän Mahävir attain Nirväna?
On which festival day did Gautam-swämi attain Keval-jnän?
quizData.answer: The first day of the New Year (the day after Diwäli).

quizData.question: At what age did Gautam-swämi attain Keval-jnän?
At what age did Gautam-swämi attain Nirväna?

graphicsData.title: The Upstaged Ceremony
graphicsData.description: The proud scholar Indrabhuti watches in fury as celestial beings fly past his grand sacrifice to honor the sermon of an unknown ascetic, Mahävir.
graphicsData.imageAlt: A priest at a fire ceremony looks up angrily as divine figures fly overhead towards a forest.

graphicsData.title: The Doubt Revealed
graphicsData.description: Mahävir stuns Indrabhuti by welcoming him by name and exposing his deepest, secret doubt about the existence of the soul, shattering his intellectual pride.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Mahävir speaks calmly to a shocked and bewildered Indrabhuti.

graphicsData.title: A Lesson in Humility
graphicsData.description: After doubting a layman, Gautam-swämi returns to Änand Shrävak to humbly ask for his forgiveness, demonstrating his lack of ego.
graphicsData.imageAlt: The monk Gautam-swämi bowing respectfully to a layman sitting in his house.

graphicsData.title: The Miraculous Meal
graphicsData.description: Using his special powers, Gautam-swämi serves kheer to 1500 hungry hermits from a single small bowl that never empties.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Gautam-swämi serving food from a small bowl to a long line of waiting hermits.

graphicsData.title: The Pain of Attachment
graphicsData.description: Learning of Mahävir's Nirväna, Gautam-swämi is overcome with grief, a moment of intense sorrow that forces him to confront his final spiritual obstacle.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Gautam-swämi crying, realizing his guru has departed from the world.

graphicsData.title: The Dawn of Omniscience
graphicsData.description: In a flash of insight, Gautam-swämi detaches from his grief and love for Mahävir, instantly destroying his remaining karma and attaining Keval-jnän.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Gautam-swämi sitting in meditation, glowing with a bright light symbolizing his enlightenment.
